snippet: In its new report, the National Consumer Law Center calls for greater federal and state oversight of certain seller-financed home sales that many view as predatory....
abstract: National Consumer Law Center says seller-financed home sales are 'toxic transactions,' and asks for more federal and state purview of sales; says many of contracts in transactions were 'built to fail' and were predatory.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: In its new report, the National Consumer Law Center calls for greater federal and state oversight of certain seller-financed home sales that many view as predatory.

headline.main: Law Center Calls Seller-Financed Home Sales ‘Toxic Transactions’
headline.print_headline: Report Calls Seller-Financed Home Sales ‘Toxic Transactions’
